intro: Elegia stipularis, commonly known as the stipular elegia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. Elegia stipularis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its botanical structure supports its role as a nectar source for various pollinators.
